Juris Doctor.definition: the lowest degree conferred by a law school usually after three years of full-time study or its equivalent compare master of laws

1.1: the lowest degree conferred by a law school usually after three years of full-time study or its equivalent compare
1.note: The juris doctor replaced the bachelor of laws as the first degree conferred by a law school in 1969. Not all states mention the J.D. or LL.B. specifically as a requirement for admission to the bar, but all states do require graduation from a law school.
